column1: What do you call a bad mexican restaurant? shitpotle
column3: The word pot can mean a cooking vessel, while it can also refer to marijuana (slang).
column4: The chef used a large pot to prepare the soup.
column5: After a long week, he decided to unwind with a pot on the weekend.

column1: How do you define a will? hint: its a dead giveaway.
column3: The word giveaway can mean a promotional item given for free or can refer to the act of unintentionally revealing a secret or information.
column4: The store had a huge giveaway event for customers during the holidays.
column5: His expression was a major giveaway that he was hiding something.

column1: What kind of appointment is always at the wrong time? dis appointment
column3: The word appointment can refer to a scheduled meeting or it can mean a position or role assigned to someone.
column4: I have a doctors appointment tomorrow at noon.
column5: His appointment as the new director will take effect next month.

column1: How does han solo like to get around endor? ewoks
column3: Walk can mean to move by putting one foot in front of the other, while it can also refer to the act of walking in a casual way, often used in the phrase to walk someone.
column4: She decided to walk to the store instead of driving.
column5: He promised to walk her to her car after the event.
